# isAccessibilitySelectorAllowed(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether assistive apps can invoke the specified selector on the accessibility element.

## Declaration

```swift
func isAccessibilitySelectorAllowed(_ selector: Selector) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **selector**: The selector to check.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], if accessibility clients can call the selector; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Configuring accessibility

- **isAccessibilityElement()**: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the accessibility element participates in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **setAccessibilityElement(_:)**: Sets a Boolean value that determines whether the accessibility element participates in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **isAccessibilityEnabled()**: Returns a Boolean value that determines whether the accessibility element responds to user events.
- **setAccessibilityEnabled(_:)**: Sets a Boolean value that determines whether the accessibility element responds to user events.
- **accessibilityFrame()**: Returns the accessibility element’s frame in screen coordinates.
- **setAccessibilityFrame(_:)**: Sets the accessibility element’s frame in screen coordinates.
- **accessibilityHelp()**: Returns the help text for the accessibility element.
- **setAccessibilityHelp(_:)**: Sets the help text for the accessibility element.
- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the accessibility element.
- **setAccessibilityLabel(_:)**: Sets a short description of the accessibility element.
- **accessibilityTitle()**: Returns the title of the accessibility element—for example, a button’s visible text.
- **setAccessibilityTitle(_:)**: Sets the title of the accessibility element.
- **accessibilityValue()**: Returns the accessibility element’s value.
- **setAccessibilityValue(_:)**: Sets the accessibility element’s value.
